intro: Dudleya moranii, commonly known as the Moran's liveforever, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves that form a rosette. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. Dudleya moranii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
